entry.title: [E2E] Fix incorrect margin for snackbar
entry.content:
The snackbar view is held by the bottom container. The bottom

container has been subscribing to the viewport inset supplier. It

has ensured the bottom container is always on the top of the keyboard.



There is no need for snackbar to add an extra margin. The reason

why there is no such a bug before https://crrev.com/c/4981466 is

because the way to calculate the keyboard height is incorrect:

it always returns a zero.



This CL removes the logic to add an extra margin for snackbar.

entry.title: v4l2/stateless: Flush buffers on EOS
entry.content:
An EOS packet can come at two different times.



a. When there are no outstanding requests the

callback can be run right away.



b. When buffers are still in the pipeline then

the callback must be delayed until they are

done being processed. This requires keeping

track of the timestamps of the last frame

enqueued and the last frame dequeued

entry.title: [Tab Switcher] TabSwitcherPaneMediator
entry.content:
A fork of the TabSwitcherMediator for panes. The code can be

significantly simplified due to panes and the Hub handling a lot of

the logic. Hub takes a lot of the visibility and back press logic away.

Panes take away incognito reauth, reset, and price tracking.



Visibility is now no longer the responsibility of the mediator nor is

managing the content size of the TabListRecyclerView as it is hosted as

a view within the Hub rather than being the child for the compositor

view.



As such, something that was almost 1200 lines is now only 400.



Bug: 1505772

entry.title: Remove instances of waitForAnimationTimeBased from tests
entry.content:
These tests were lumped together because of the common pattern for

fixing. The gestures cannot be updated to use test-driver since

using fling mechanics or conditionally using imprecise wheel ticks.

entry.title: Move version_info into //base
entry.content:
This is a step to move version_info from //components into //base,

which is a dependency of cached feature flags which is also getting

moved to //base.



//components/version_info is left as a facade of //base/version_info.



This CL leaves two copies of Channel.java, one in //components

(copy of the auto-generated) and one in //base (auto-generated),

in order to perform the migration to //base downstream. Soon after,

https://crrev/c/5142488 will delete

//components/version_info/.../Channel.java. I cannot do it on the same

CL because of the Java @interface Channel which cannot easily be made

into a facade. The upstream references are migrated in this same CL.

entry.title: view-transition: Fix RuleSet invalidation for VT pseudos
entry.content:
The view-transition pseudo elements are manually style invalidated

whenever the document element is [1]. This assumes that the document

element will be invalidated whenever the view transition pseudo styles

need to be recalculated.



It seems this was often be the case but due to over-invalidation.

https://crrev.com/c3afc7e99450 improved the style system to invalidate

only when a matching selector's rules changed, rather than the whole

stylesheet. As a consequence, changing a ::view-transition rule in a

stylesheet no longer (incidentally) invalidates the document element so

the changes aren't made visually.



RuleSetChange based invalidation is applied by walking the Element

tree[2] which doesn't include pseudo elements. Instead, a pseudo element

selector should match its originating element which will cause its

invalidation. Setting the `dynamic_pseudo` on the result will prevent

the rule from being collected in [3]. The view transition pseudos were

only matching when in the context of a pseudo element which prevented

this invalidation.



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/dom/node.cc;l=1307;drc=35cedca3b1ad347c2b576e1d8eed30102a625a31

[2] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/css/style_engine.cc;l=2225;drc=36f47fc1f93ac985138ef4579fdead05ae19c9ed

[3] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/css/element_rule_collector.cc;l=1178;drc=e5f8ff312fe542f39c7d34b4440f18d1500b15f9



Bug: 1508345

Change-Id: Ia92ecfb2fb5138920eda145f83b5367f9b9ce77d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5147306

entry.title: Check that handle is valid before calling WriteFile
entry.content:
In some cases a Write can be issued during channel shutdown

but after ShutdownOnIoThread() has been called causing a

call to WriteFile with a nullptr HANDLE to be issued. In

most cases this simply fails (gle=6) but if enhanced

handle checks are enabled (e.g. with App Verifier) this

can lead to crashes.



This CL prevents writes before closing the handle, and changes IsValid

and Get calls on handle_ to the new is_valid() and get().



Bug: 1508832

Change-Id: I8c2dcf2dbf7b36d79962c1167382d06ba4b28f96

entry.title: bounds_tracker: Remapping/restoring windows on mirroring
entry.content:
Remapping/restoring on mirroring is actually the same as removing

the mirroring target displays. The only issue is that we need to use

the in session work area instead of the display's current work area to

guarantee that the work area consistency while doing window bounds

remapping and restoration.

entry.title: [iOS] Delay keyboardAccessoryView initialization in Omnibox Coordinator
entry.content:
We found that the keyboardAccessoryView was being initialized at startup

which adds (according to Instruments) ~31ms to startup latency. This CL

delays this initialization until after startup since we don't need the

keyboard accessory view until we receive a user action on an omnibox.

Doing this will improve startup latency and should be a noop from a user

perspective.



Bug: 1515588

entry.title: Reland "[MDL] Only build bypass rules for clients that use them"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit b6f9ad85160292eb507658fce31fa37cb9ac80ee



Original change's description:

> [MDL] Only build bypass rules for clients that use them

>

> WebView clients don't need the bypass rules, so significant memory

> savings are gained by not creating them.

>

entry.title: SyncToSigninMigration: Disable Addresses for custom passphrase users
entry.content:
Pre-migration: For syncing custom passphrase users,

only AUTOFILL_PROFILE is supported for "Addresses" - CONTACT_INFO is

disabled.

Post-migration: Only CONTACT_INFO is supported, but it does not support

custom passphrase.

To avoid negative surprises, the migration should thus turn off

"Addresses" for custom passphrase users. They can turn it back on in

settings (and will see a message about custom passphrase not being

supported there).

entry.title: [shared storage] Fix duplicate console outputs handling
entry.content:
Issue: "console" outputs became automatically supported with the

worklet integration with DevTools. It conflicts with the pre-existing

manual logging via `devtools_instrumentation::LogWorkletMessage()`,

causing duplicate logging of each message.



This CL:

1) Removes the manual devtools_instrumentation::LogWorkletMessage().

2) Re-purpose mojom::SharedStorageWorkletServiceClient::ConsoleLog() to

::DidAddMessageToConsole(). We still want the observer method, so that

existing tests that relies on `WebContentsConsoleObserver` can still

work. The idea is to keep mimicking what's being done for console

outputs from Window context, which manually triggers the observer

method via mojom::LocalFrameHost::DidAddMessageToConsole().

3) Use the original log level in the observer method, rather than

always using `kInfo`. This aligns with the actual log level.



Bug: 1515719

Change-Id: I7a15d4727d2affba03c2e575c251d63b09c62404

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5171585

entry.title: Reland "Webview suppress tap during fling"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 5bad326c9844df90aa35c49edd3e8005869128a4



Fix the edge case where fling was cancelled in OnBeginFrame before

the first draw call. Normally OnComputeScroll is called after

OnBeginFrame and before draw. However the failing cts manages to

trigger a fling before the first draw, which is then promptly

cancelled. Fix by making sure draw has happened at least once

before cancelling fling.



Original change's description:

> Webview suppress tap during fling

>

> For apps that disables fling in webview by not calling computeScroll,

> webview still internally has a fling curve that's just not ticked. This

> caused crbug.com/514783 for those apps because tap during fling cancels

> the fling instead of registering as a tap. The old fix was to turn off

> this tap suppression during fling entirely, which causes this current

> bug where apps that allow normal fling will have tap register as a tap,

> which differs from chrome behavior.

>

> This changes so that fling is cancelled entirely for apps that do not

> call computeScroll, but keeps tap suppression behavior.

>

> Bug: 1474135

> Change-Id: Ia549c1a1f955bbc1526e58620331ee7a0283afe9

entry.title: iwa: Remove `base::ShadowingAtExitManager` from unit tests
entry.content:
Using `base::ShadowingAtExitManager` seems to be the cause for the

`IsolatedWebAppReaderRegistryFactoryTest` test being flaky on ASAN

builds and causing dangling pointers. The test failures and dangling

pointers all seem to revolve around wrong destruction order of other

`KeyedService`s that are not specifically related to IWAs.



Originally, `IsolatedWebAppReaderRegistryFactory` used

`base::Singleton`, which internally uses `base::AtExitManager`. However,

after the refactoring in crrev.com/c/4573686, the code now uses

`base::NoDestructor`, which does not interact with `base::AtExitManager`

at all. Thus the test also definitely no longer needs to use

`base::ShadowingAtExitManager`. I don't fully remember why I originally

added `base::ShadowingAtExitManager` to the test.



Bug: 925323

Change-Id: I994caf898562a604d37fa3151202667799e6bda1

Fixed: 1515535

entry.title: Make cargo vet work with our audits file and gnrt groups for crates
entry.content:
* Fix up the contents of audits.toml to be valid

* Add the imports.lock file which must be present

* Make the config.toml for vet become generated by `gnrt vendor`.

* Forward criteria from the google audit repo into ours so we can

use them.



By generating the config.toml we can specify what policy we want

applied to each crate based on its group and shipped flags in the

gnrt_config.toml.



`cargo vet` does not yet pass, since we are missing audits for almost

all of our 3p crates at their given versions. Since we have reviewed

them, audits should be added next.

directly from VariationsService, which will return an empty string

country limitation not work on local builds. This CL fixes this

entry.title: [Passwords] Do not use crowdsourcing when parsing forms on localhost
entry.content:
Crowdsourcing helps to classify forms online, based on signals from

different users about the same form. However on localhost it's likely

that semantically different forms will receive same signatures, so

PasswordManager should not use server predictions and upload votes

for such forms.



The follow-up CL will stop uploading votes.

entry.title: [UPMLocalSettings] PasswordSafetyCheckController introduced into password_manager code
entry.content:
This CL introduces the interface PasswordSafetyCheckController that is

supposed to be created as a helper for SafetyCheckMediator to handle

password check state. GmsCorePasswordSafetyCheckController implements

the interface and uses Gms core functionality for the password check.

Method

PasswordsCheckPreferenceProperties.passwordsStateFromPasswordCheckResult

will be used to convert the password check result provided by the

controller into the PasswordsState known to the SafetyCheckMediator.



There will be 2 implementations of the interface:

- One for the password check done on the Gms core side.

- One for the password check in Chrome.



The old Chrome internal implementation will be introduced in the follow

up CLs. The correct version of PasswordSafetyCheckController will be

instantiated and used for the SafetyCheckMediator depending on whether

the Gms core is being used or not.



Bug: b/312930046

entry.title: Dismiss the keyboard when dragging Tab Grid search results
entry.content:
This CL dismisses the keyboard as soon as the scrollview with the search

results is scrolled.



Prior to the new Compositional Layout, this was not an issue, as there

was a bug where the Suggested Actions had a way too large height,

leading to the Suggested Actions not being able to be occluded by the

keyboard. But the Compositional Layout gives it its correct height,

leaving it hidden behind the keyboard.



An alternative fix would be to subscribe to the keyboard notifications,

and adapt the scroll view's additional safe area insets but it's more

cumbersome.



Fixed: 1515895

entry.title: Update rounding behavior for battery fill level
entry.content:
There are only 10 dips to play with for battery fill level.



The old behavior always rounds down (floor rounding) so a charge

level of 29% and a charge level of 20% both only have 2 pixels of

fill height.



UX prefers we normally round below 50% battery and floor round

otherwise. This means that a charge level of 25% would have 3 pixels

of fill, so it would look more accurate at lower battery levels.



Bug: b:302345829

entry.title: [sharing] Avoid direct exposure of syncer::DeviceInfo in sharing APIs
entry.content:
No behavioral changes, pure refactoring.



Using syncer::DeviceInfo in public sharing APIs such as SharingService

goes against the abstraction layer and leaks the underlying mechanism

to list remote devices via sync. syncer::DeviceInfo also grew over time

and a) contains low-level information that sharing users shouldn't

consume and b) has performance implications when it comes to copying

around device information.



As a first step, this patch introduces SharingTargetDeviceInfo which

is just an alias for syncer::DeviceInfo.

entry.title: Expand the OperationResult metric to log for all completion callbacks
entry.content:
In addition to logging after the network request completes, the metric

now logs whenever the service's lookup completes, including:

- if it's in backoff mode

- if it fully hits the local cache

- if it fails to fetch a valid OHTTP key



Due to the scope change, the SafeBrowsing.HPRT.OperationResult histogram

is renamed to SafeBrowsing.HPRT.OperationOutcome.



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[SafeBrowsing.HPRT.OperationResult]=Replaced by SafeBrowsing.HPRT.OperationOutcome.



Bug: 1392143, 1407283

entry.title: display: Resolution inconsistency when native mode is not supported
entry.content:
Currently, when an external display is connected for the first time and

there is no mode selected explicitly by user, calling

`GetActiveModeForDisplayId` will retrieve the native mode. However, this

is incorrect (b/309725817) if native mode is not supported and system

falls back to a lower mode.



Rather than returning the native mode, this CL checks display_info for

currently active mode first.

entry.title: [iOS] change when search engine choice screen appears in tests.
entry.content:
This CL does two related changes in EG-tests.



1: This CL avoid the search-engines choice screen when possible. This

has two benefits:

* tests become faster, as some actions are not needed anymore

* tests that do not consider those screens will not fail.



Those failures seemed to occur only on tests run on developer machine

and not on bots. My assumption is that it is because some developers

are in Europe while the bots are not.



2: The tests that runs with search engine can now be executed on

upstream instead of being only executed in ios_internal.



This CL introduces two new functions, `IsChoiceEnabledInNormalRun` and

`ios::first_run::IsSearchEngineChoiceScreenEnabledFre` that are used

to decide whether the choice view is enabled or not. They behave

similarly:

* if the new forcing flag is enabled, the search engine choice view is

necessarily enabled,

* otherwise, if we are in a build target for tests, the view is

disabled,

* otherwise, if the view is not enabled by the normal feature flag,

then the choice is not enabled

* otherwise we delegate to the choice from the provider.



The last two steps are redundant, as the provider always answer false

when the feature flag is disabled. The goal here is, in a future CL,

to allow to simplify the function in the provider.



This CL is part of the sequence:

+ crrev.com/c/5169127

** crrev.com/i/6838015

** crrev.com/i/6838014

*** crrev.com/c/5168894

**** crrev.com/i/6838016



Low-Coverage-Reason: OTHER Those are tests utils

but it is obviously unreasonable. We should not use this behavior.

entry.title: wayland: dnd: move data fetching out of main thread
entry.content:
So far, in incoming data drag sessions - ie: when drag is originated

in external clients other than the ozone/wayland embedder - the data for

each offered mime type is incrementally fetched in the main/ui thread

using wl_display.sync callbacks. i.e: several wayland roundtrips

potentially required to "announce" the drag enter to the upper layers.

That is sub-optimal and has some side effects related to event

propagation which has been the source of subtle and sometime hard to

diagnose issues.



With this change, the data reading is offloaded to a separate thread and

related tests are updated accordingly. For now, DragEnter keeps coupled

to DataFetchCompleted. That will be addressed in a separate CL.



Design/Explainer: https://github.com/nickdiego/chromium-docs/blob/main/wl-dnd-data-fetch/explainer.md



Bug: 1487784

Test: relevant ozone_unittests updated accordingly.
